p: Of the six remaining antibodies (1.6c7, 1.6f9, 4.6e10, 7.7g6, 3.5g6, 1.8e5), only antibody 1.6c7 showed a mild multifocal staining of cilia accompanied by a strong background reactivity ( Fig. 2D). The other five antibodies (1.6f9, 4.6e10, 7.7g6, 1.8e5, 3.5g6) did not reveal any recognizable specific staining of MERS-CoV antigen on FFPE tissue along with no to very mild (1.6f9, 4.6e10, Fig. 3 A, B), mild (7.7g6, 1.8e5, Fig. 3C, D) and strong (3.5g6, Fig. 3E) non-specific background staining. By contrast, all antibodies displayed a distinct signal by immunofluorescence staining of MERS-CoV-infected Huh-7 cells in culture ( Widjaja et al., 2019). Possible explanations for the lack of immunoreactivity on FFPE tissue include effacement of conformational epitopes by formalin fixation and/or antigen retrieval protocols ( Smedley et al., 2007).
